subject: Re: [junit] The possibility to use more Runners in one JUnit class
msgSnippet: Gabriel, The bad news: there are fairly big architectural reasons that you can only have one runner per class. The good news: as of 4.7, basic per-test
messageBody:
Gabriel,

The bad news: there are fairly big architectural reasons that you can
only have one runner per class.

The good news: as of 4.7, basic per-test functionality like setting up
mocks works great in a Rule, and you can combine any number of Rules
with a Runner like Parameters.

I'd first contact the Mockito maintainers to see if they've already
considered writing a rule. If not, I'm happy to advise on how such a
thing could be built.

David Saff

On Thu, Feb 4, 2010 at 2:42 AM, Gabriel Forro <gforro.work@...> wrote:
> Hello everybody,
>
> please let me know, whether it is possible to define more Runner
> implementations in one JUnit class.
> In my case I would like to use both org.junit.runners.Parameterized and
> org.mockito.runners.MockitoJUnitRunner runners. The first one because of
> providing test data, the second one because of setting up Mockito mock
> objects.
>
> The current version of @RunWidth annotation can take just one Runner. Is
> there any workaround to use more runners?
> If not, could this feature be added in the future versions of JUnit?
>
> Best regards,
>
> Gabriel
